intro: Maesa haenkeana, commonly known as the New Zealand maesa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant typically grows as a low, dense shrub with small, leathery leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, appearing in clusters during the spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or subalpine regions.
